page.title: 16COMMONERS OF PILLEY/BOLDRE
page.content: There are about 15 practising Commoners in the block who run from 1-10 ponies each,about 120 in all. There's no money in it,it's a way of life really,said the local coal merchant who runs both ponies and cattle on the forest.It is the link with the land and an older life style that makes him a practising commoner. My parents ran ponies and when my sons were born we gave them a foal each to get them started.They are buying and breeding their own now.Mind you,its slowly getting to be a better breed, controls are tighter and standards higher. The conservationists don't always understand.When they put the grids in and kept the animals from the villages it changed things.There is good early grazing in the verges and shelter along the hedgerows that they can't reach now,it made them hardier.
